content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an example of how you can solve this problem using regular expressions:
```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks and their contents
    code_blocks = collect(Markdown.extract_code_blocks(md))

    # Join the content of each block into a single string with newlines
    joined_code = join(map(x -> x.content, code_blocks), "\n")

    return joined_code
end
``` 
This function uses `Markdown.extract_code_blocks` to find all the code blocks in your Markdown document and then extracts the content from each block. It joins them together with a newline character, effectively concatenating multiple blocks of code into a single string.
